title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
The U.S. and EU agreed to suspend tariffs on wine, luggage, produce and other goods related to a longstanding dispute over government subsidies to Boeing and Airbus, in a sign of easing trade tensions.

---

Senate Democrats struck a deal to extend $300 weekly federal jobless benefits through Sept. 6 after negotiations with Manchin, clearing the way for the coronavirus aid package's expected passage Saturday.

---

California paved the way for Disneyland and other attractions across the state to reopen as soon as next month, according to new guidelines on Covid-19 restrictions.

---

New York state lawmakers moved to curtail management powers granted to Gov. Cuomo during the coronavirus pandemic.

---

The top U.S. envoy to Afghanistan proposed the idea of a grand conference of Afghan and Taliban leaders to create an interim government, U.S. and Afghan officials said.

---

The White House signaled that it is ready to negotiate a new congressional authorization for when and where it can use military force.

---

Texas' public utility commission signaled it didn't intend to reverse $16 billion in electric overcharges flagged by an independent monitor.
